direction.raw_text: Robert's eyes flutter open as he comes to, groggy. He's badly injured, but breathing. He starts to feel his body. Movement returns... He looks over at Julie. It is instantly obvious she is dead: she's been nearly decapitated, a deep gash ripping through her neck. Shock, followed quickly by panic. We hear a DRIPPING sound. A gas leak... Robert reaches into his pocket and dials 911... He looks at the phone just before pressing "Send"... and hangs up. He tries to open the door. It's stuck. He KICKS at it. It opens.

direction.raw_text: He drags himself out of the car. Stands. Smoke is still rising from the smashed hood. He pulls up his shirt. A DEEP BRUISE: a broken rib from the steering column. He winces. He takes a few steps forward, moving around to the passenger side. He looks again at Julie. Horrific. He reaches out to touch her, then stops. Hold on his face. He sinks to his knees, putting his head in his bloody hands. He SCREAMS. Then he rises, and begins hiking to the side of the road.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you got?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got any milk?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll take a water. Jimmy starts running the tap. Robert notices the moving BOXES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boxes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was planning on Virginia, but it looks like I'm not going anymore. Jimmy returns with the water. Robert take a drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You waiting for me to say something? Goldenrod - 4.17.11 85.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you not to take the toll.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, you did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said "Listen to what I have to tell you and follow my directions, listen to me closely, do the following just like I say."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. You said all that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you took the toll anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I did not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Jimmy, don't fucking lie to me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not lying! I took ninety-five all the Goddamn way there. I did what you said: I didn't stop. I didn't take the Triborough. I followed all your fucking instructions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So where'd they get the photograph from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You tell me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, you're saying... it's a fake?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How'd you get so fuckin' rich again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be such a wiseass...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, this is my fuckin' life, man! Earl's telling me it could be ten years? Ten fucking years! How much are ten years worth, Robert? (off his silence) Goldenrod - 4.17.11 86.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look man, I told you, I ain't no fuckin snitch, but this is bad. This is real bad. Reina and I got a whole plan we're about to make happen next week!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (as Jimmy sits) What plan?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got money saved up; I'm buying a business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What business?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I bought an Applebee's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's an Applebee's?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a fucking restaurant, man, it's a chain restaurant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bought an Applebee's in Virginia?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this really what you came here to talk about? What are you gonna do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not really that simple, Jimmy. I'm in a situation now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What situation?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you... right now, if I were to speak, a lot of people would get hurt. Jobs, families. A lot of innocent people. Do you think you can understand that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah but what about me? What about my situation? (off his silence) They showed me pictures, man; that's fucked up what you did. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 87.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was an accident.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And yeah, I know, all the people counting on you, whatever, but -- you told me Earl was gonna make this right. Now you know I care about you, all the things you did for us, and for my father, but Earl said they're offering me a deal, no charges at all. I walk away. They just want to know who I went to pick up. (BEAT) Why are you putting me in this position, man? Why are you putting me in this situation?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you just hang tight? Just a little longer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright, man, but Earl said the deal's on the table for twenty-four hours. After that, they're filing the case, and Earl says we're gonna lose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nods, stands) Alright I hear you. I'll be back with you as soon as I can. Just hang with me a little bit. Jimmy nods. Robert walks out. Reina crosses back into the living room as he approaches the door and exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gotta give him up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said take the money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was to keep quiet, not to go away. (BEAT) What's he offering you now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What can he offer me? Goldenrod - 4.17.11 88. Reina crosses to Jimmy and hugs him as he starts to cry, then wipes away his tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The limo drives down Fifth Avenue. Robert's on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) We went to the toll authority. They said they gave the tape to the cops. I've requested our investigator go examine it at the evidence room, but honestly what's the point?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He says he didn't take the toll.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) And you believe him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (after a beat) Does Standard have clawback?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) What? What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's just say I decide to go in...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Have you lost your mind?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, just listen, listen to me. If I were to surrender, now, could they roll back the deal?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (after a beat) No, what's done is done. There's no intent to defraud. You haven't warranted any behavior. So it's just money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Four years, you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) At this point- I dunno, they're not gonna make it easy.... I really suggest you think about this. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 89.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call the DA, get it started. Robert hangs up. He stares out the window at Central Park.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He enters the foyer and ascends the steps to his bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No Ellen. He looks at his watch: "8:34PM." He moves over towards the bed and dials the tableside PHONE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, Glen. Did Mrs. Miller say where she was going tonight...? Aha... No, I'm sure... I'll try her cell. He clicks off and DIALS another number, hears Ellen's voice mail come on the line, and hangs up. He exhales and lies down on the bed in his clothes, staring at the ceiling. He lies motionless a moment. And then he sits up, thinks, and shakes his head. He quickly picks up the phone, stabbing at the keys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Syd...? Yeah- Did you make that call to the DA yet...? Thank God. No, no, no. No. Listen to me, call Earl, tell him to get his car, tell him to meet us at my house in twenty minutes... And, Syd...? Bring a notary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A steady stream of CARS passes through the toll. We follow a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as it approaches the far right lane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Earl Monroe pays the TOLL CLERK through the window, getting a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Then he pulls his car to the side of the road, parking at a BUILDING labelled "Port Authority - Administration." Goldenrod - 4.17.11 90. He opens a LAPTOP on the passenger seat, typing numbers from the toll receipt into a little box on the screen. A portable
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: spits out pages. Earl stamps them with a NOTARY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Earl waits at the front desk of the drab government office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a balding man in his 30's, approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi I'm Brent Owens, the night supervisor. How can I help you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (handing him some papers) Hello, Brent. I'm Earl Monroe. I'm executing a criminal evidence request. I need to get a look at one of your lane tapes. Brent looks over the papers, confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't understand. This says you want to look at a tape made ten minutes ago...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robert and Syd stare ahead, silently. Syd tries to say something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (holding up his hand) Wait. Wait. Just wait.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Syd slumps back. They keep staring at nothing. 121 A RAPPING noise on the window startles Syd, who rolls it down, sees Earl, and opens the door. Earl climbs inside, removing a FOLIO from his breast pocket as he talks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, they won't release tapes without a court order, but they did give me a print out, the same kind they used at Jimmy's indictment. Earl reaches inside the folio and removes the PHOTOGRAPH he got from the toll authority. He lays it on the counter. It's from a toll camera, showing his car and license plate. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 91.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Lexus- that's your car, your plate? Earl nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got Jimmy's? Syd lays the PHOTOGRAPH we saw earlier of Jimmy's car going through the toll onto the counter next to the one Earl has just placed there. Robert picks up a high-end MAGNIFYING GLASS and leans over to look at the two photos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He scans the photograph of Earl's car, moving slowly through it left-to-right. Then he scans the photograph of Jimmy's car, passing left-to- right until -- He passes back by the license plate area and stops -- The lines around the license plate of Jimmy's car are all slightly-pixelated. He switches back to the plate on Earl's car. The lines are fine. Back to Jimmy's. Pixelated. Robert puts down the magnifier, straightens, and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son of a bitch. Earl's dark laugh cackles across the soundtrack as we
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Earl sits across from DA Deferlito and Bryer. JUDGE RITTENBAND reviews both TOLL PHOTOS with a MAGNIFYING GLASS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well they look a little different to me, too... Is there a reason you haven't allowed Mr. Monroe's investigator to conduct his own analysis? Goldenrod - 4.17.11 92.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've had some issues regarding chain-of-custody...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...You don't have them anymore. You're to meet him with the evidence in the next hour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm afraid that's not possible. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's the tape? (ANOTHER BEAT) Am I not speaking loud enough?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your honor...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It seems there's been...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Let him tell me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't know where it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not in the evidence locker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't know. Silence. Rittenband leans forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll ask you one last time, detective. Where is the tape?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (after a beat) We lost it. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 93.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmmm... In light of these developments, and I would think you should be very happy to hear this, with Mr. Monroe's approval I'm going to offer Mr. Deferlito the opportunity to voluntarily dismiss the indictment to save us all a bunch of embarrassment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't feel comfortable with that, your honor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Further I'm going to put all charges against Mr. Grant under seal. (Bryer starts heading to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This case is dismissed with prejudice and it is not to be refiled. HOLD ON, Detective. (Bryer stops.) If you have another suspect in the automobile death then you are to present him, but Mr. Grant is free from any further inquiry in this matter. This is over. Do I have your understanding?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. Deferlito gets up angrily, huffs past Bryer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Close the door, detective, please... Bryer closes it. The judge holds up the toll photos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You finessed these, didn't you...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...You finessed it. I know it, and you know it. No response. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 94.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know who you're after. I saw all the evidence, not just the toll photo. You gotta get him the right way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, okay. (approaches the judge) So let me get this straight: What you're telling me is I'm supposed to sit around with my thumb up my ass and my fingers crossed hoping that one of these fucking days, somewhere down the line, one of these rich assholes is gonna say the wrong thing
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: enough so that we can't choose to ignore it anymore?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get the fuck outta of my office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, your honor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mills waits on a nearby bench, watching as Bryer exits the chambers dialing his phone. DeFerlito walks up to Bryer, and grabs him. Bryer breaks free, aggressively, phone to his ear. Mills approaches. Bryer waves him away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (on the phone) Well when do you expect her...? When do you expect her? Okay, well so I don't have to call a ninth time, will you take down what I'm sayin', word for word...? Okay, you got a pencil? You ready? Okay, here goes: "Mrs. Miller- Exactly how fuckin' stupid do you really think I am?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robert and Jimmy sit. Jimmy looks at the TRUST DOCUMENT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't hurt anybody. You helped a lot of people. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 95.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And this piece of paper makes everything okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it makes it easier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You worried I'm gonna say something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Jimmy keeps staring at the document.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robert, look: you asked me to come meet you and I'm here, but I came because I wanted to get something straight between us: we're even.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, we're even. But just for the record though, what you did... (picks up the trust document) Was way beyond the money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing's beyond money for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks a lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pointing to the document) And if I take this, then what does that say about me? He thinks a moment, then folds the document and puts it in his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck it. I'm gonna take your money and do something good with it. Hold on Jimmy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellen is dressed in a full BALL GOWN. She sits at on the sofa finishing a drink. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 96. Robert enters and begins changing into a TUXEDO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, sweetie. What time you wanna get there...? I don't wanna get there too soon... She doesn't say anything. He waits a moment, then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (tying his tie) You okay? What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You spoke to Brooke? He slows... Something's brewing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did she tell you that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. She didn't have to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I explained to Brooke that...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...you explained, did you? (A BEAT) Did you tell her everything?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything? (off his silence) Lift up your shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lift up -- your shirt. He doesn't move. She stands and heads towards him. Then she hits him with a a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: right at his broken rib. He winces a little, then looks down at the floor. It's the Post article chronicling Julie's death. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 97.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you tell her about that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellen I don't know what you think you know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, don't treat me like an idiot. You've been sneaking off to see her for months. You don't think I know that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never cared, really, about your secretaries, your- gallerists, whores, whatever you wanna call them. I cared about our home. And now you have brought this to our door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did what was necessary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No you did what was necessary for you, Robert, for your interests.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For my interests?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything I do is for us, for this family, and now you're gonna tell me how to run my business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't about your business, this is our life! Where do you think we're going tonight? Why do you think I've even tolerated this for so long?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he's had enough) What you've tolerated? Wow!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm glad you find that funny. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 98.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about me? What about the complaints? The unhappiness? The drinking? The shopping? The trainers? Everything! But yes, the charities, the wonderful sainted charities, you know, all the wonderful works that you do. How do you think I've paid for them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't ask you because I didn't want you to lie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's cause you didn't want to give `em up!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I thought that we had an understanding. And you broke that understanding when you brought Brooke into it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I kept her out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When you made Brooke complicit-- when you risked her future-- and I'm done. She opens a FOLDER revealing some legal documents, slides them toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Read it. He crosses to the bed and puts on his glasses. We see the title: "SEPARATION AGREEMENT" and hold on him reading for a few brief seconds until...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "All ownership and voting rights transfer to the Miller Charitable Foundation, to be administered by Brooke Miller?" Did you really expect me to sign this thing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not following. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 99.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Apparently not, no. No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (like talking to a child) Okay, uhm, the police have been trying to talk me. I assume they want to know where you were that night. And you know what? I'm not gonna lie for you anymore. Not unless you sign that. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, this leaves me with nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you'll find a way to manage. I'm sure you have all kinds of things offshore for a rainy day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is fuckin' crazy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, if you sign, then I'll tell your lie. I'll say you were at home with me that night, all night, together, here, and you'll be free and clear. And the people who need our money will get it. That's my price.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're out of your mind. I am not signing that. I will not sign that!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well then... I'll have to tell them that you came home at four-thirty bruised and bleeding...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's fucking ridiculous! What... (crosses close to her) Are you trying to blackmail me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think we call it negotiating. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 100.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not gonna win that one. There's no fucking way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what, it'll cause just enough trouble- the kind of trouble that you don't want-- In fact, according to my lawyer
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fucking lawyer...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's enough to give them probable cause and then they can subpoena your cell phone, GPS, DNA, ROBERT Fuck the DNA! I'm sick of this!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And whatever else they can think of. So really Robert what you have is a choice: you can spend the next three years in court and in the tabloids or-- you can be at your business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won't do it. You won't do this. You won't do it to the kids.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just try me. He stares at her, trying to make it work, but he can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You broke -- our little girl's heart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's how it all works, Ellen. You know that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do, but she didn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She'll be better for it. The world is cold. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 101.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (turns and heads out) Then you're gonna need a warm coat. We hold on Robert's face. PRE-LAP Bill Evans' "My Foolish Heart."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The car rides up Madison Avenue. Mayfield marks up a bunch of memos in a leather-bound folder. An aide we met earlier, JOHN AIMES, sits nearby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's just one more thing... And I hate to mention it now, but I just received it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Speak, John. Aimes opens a FOLDER, handing it to Mayfield.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had Stern Marling run a secondary audit on the Miller financials. We catch a glimpse of the top sheet as Mayfield reads:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - MILLER CAPITAL - We have reviewed the records you submitted and have found no way to legitimately substantiate a recent capital transfer of $412 Million..." We hold on Mayfield's face as he tries hard to conceal the spreading realization.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who authorized this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (after a beat) And what did you conclude?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's in front of you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't ask you what the paper said, John. I asked you what you thought. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 102.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (after a beat, carefully) Well... what do you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think... I think... that I don't see anything wrong here. Mayfield closes the folder and places it with the rest of his papers. Aimes nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They arrive at the Plaza Hotel and exit the car
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see throngs of the wealthy ascend the steps leading up to the opulent hall. Lining the walls are plaques for: "Mt. Sinai Hospital - Miller Oncology Center."
direction.name: direction
